contentrichtext.text: '''Edward''' (1284–1329), surnamed '''the Liberal''', was the Count of [[Savoy]] from 1323 to 1329. Edward was born at [[Baugé]]. He was married to [[Bianca of Burgundy|Blanche (Bianca)]] of [[Burgundy (region)|Burgundy]], daughter of [[Robert II, Duke of Burgundy]] and [[Agnes of France, Duchess of Burgundy]]. They had a daughter, [[Joan of Savoy|Joan (Giovanna)]], who married to [[John III, Duke of Brittany|John III the Good]], [[duke of Brittany]]. but was childless ==References== <references /> {{Unreferenced|date=November 2006}} {{S-start}} {{s-hou|[[House of Savoy]]||1284||1329}} {{s-reg|}} {{s-bef|before=[[Amadeus V of Savoy|Amadeus V]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Count of Savoy]]|years=1323–1329 }} {{s-aft|after=[[Aimone of Savoy|Aimon]]}} {{S-end}} {{Counts of Savoy}} {{Persondata | name = Edward, Count of Savoy | alternative names = | short description = | date of birth = 1284 | place of birth = | date of death = 1329 | place of death = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Edward, Count of Savoy}} [[Category:1284 births]] [[Category:1329 deaths]] [[Category:People from Maine-et-Loire]] [[Category:House of Savoy]] {{Europe-royal-stub}}
